discussion.content:
I disagree. NAM is the Network Access Manager, which helps to configure settings to connect to WLAN. It does not provide any reporting or data collection functions.
It is true that DART is a troubleshooting tool, but as such it collects information about the network environment.
DART is for tshooting anyconnect issues. NAM is correct answer.

questions.question_text: What AnyConnect module can be used to provide a detailed scan list of the Wi-Fi environment?

choices.B: Web Policy Slash Page Web Redirect

questions.question_text: An engineer wants to have users who connect to a WLAN be redirected to a terms-of-service page with the company logo and a login. What should be configured on the WLAN to enable this capability?

discussion.content: I agree, LEAP allowed its mutual authentication transactions to be sent out in the clear and not in any encrypted form. PEAP was supposed to address this issue. Basically, PEAP encapsulates its EAP communication within a TLS tunnel and requires a certificate to only be installed on the authentication server for encryption.

Anybody comment whu its FAST ? As per one of the Cisco text i read :
Cisco, Microsoft and RSA Security are promoting a more secure version of EAP, Protected Extensible Authentication Protocol (PEAP), as an Internet standard. That protocol is expected to displace LEAP.

Anybody else want to comment on this ?

questions.question_text: What protocol overcomes the weaknesses of LEAP?
What two methods of authentication are available for Local EAP?

discussion.content:
Local EAP is only used when your chosen RADIUS server(s) are unreachable or not configured.

While using local EAP, the authentication can take place locally on the controller or through an LDAP server.
B is 100% wrong. I'll go with A.

comments.content:
Changed my mind, B is correct.
https://community.cisco.com/t5/wireless-mobility-documents/cisco-guest-access-using-wlc-with-anchor-setup-release-7-0/ta-p/3149622

choices.E: Layer 3 Security must be configured for Web Policy Passthrough.
choices.A: The mobility anchor is currently unreachable.
choices.B: The mobility anchor must also be included in the mobility group of the WLC.
choices.D: The mobility anchor is attached to another WLAN.
choices.C: Layer 3 Security must be configured for Web Policy Authentication.
